meanings.definition: Prove (a statement or theory) to be wrong or false.
meanings.sent1: She refutes the idea that cats are better pets than dogs.
meanings.sent2: He refutes the claim that the Earth is flat with scientific evidence.
meanings.sent3: The comedian refutes the rumor that he is afraid of spiders by holding a tarantula on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her success in the competition refutes any doubts about her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause refutes the belief that the audience was not enjoying the performance.

meanings.definition: Deny or contradict (a statement or accusation).
meanings.sent1: The suspect refutes the allegations of stealing the missing jewelry.
meanings.sent2: She refutes the idea that she was the one who broke the vase.
meanings.sent3: The student refutes the teacher's claim that he didn't submit his homework by showing the receipt.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor refutes any suspicions of his involvement in the argument.
meanings.sent5: The clear video evidence refutes any doubts about who started the fight.
